articles.title: Benefits of EHV-1 vaccinations at horse boarding facilities highlighted in study - Horsetalk
articles.description: Researchers investigated a total of 589 horses on 13 premises in Europe in search of risk factors for the development of Equid Herpesvirus Myeloencephalopathy.

articles.title: Sixth-ever predicted earthbound asteroid seen in Ontario night sky - Geelong Advertiser
articles.description: The European Space Agency (ESA) said that a fireball seen shooting through the sky over Ontario on November 19 was just the sixth object to be detected in space before entering Earth’s atmosphere.
articles.content: The European Space Agency (ESA) said that a fireball seen shooting through the sky over Ontario on November 19 was just the sixth object to be detected in space before entering Earth’s atmosphere.

articles.title: FIFA World Cup: European teams ditch armbands after yellow card threat - National | Globalnews.ca - Global News
articles.description: The captains of seven European nations won't wear armbands supporting the 'One Love' campaign in games after FIFA said the players would be shown yellow cards.
articles.content:
FIFA’s threat of on-field punishment for players forced World Cup teams to back down Monday and abandon an anti-discrimination campaign aimed at host nation Qatar.

articles.title: Top Russian official warns of possible nuclear accident at Zaporizhzhia - Reuters
articles.description: The head of Russia's state-run atomic energy agency, Rosatom, warned on Monday there was a risk of a nuclear accident at the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant, Europe's largest, following renewed shelling over the weekend.
articles.content: LONDON, Nov 21 (Reuters) - The head of Russia's state-run atomic energy agency, Rosatom, warned on Monday there was a risk of a nuclear accident at the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant, Europe's larg… [+1478 chars]
